Articles.Content:
I use my kraken-away to get the foam away.

The user below me is being talked to death by people who believe that consoles are 300% superior than PC.

I open my $900 gaming desktop, take out one of my RAM sticks, and slit my throat to end the suffering.

The next user's most expensive electronic device explodes in their face.

tHe PoWeR oF nEgReP dEfEnDs Me

NeXt PoStEr SuMoNs GiC tHe WrOnG wAy

I do not know how to summon the Green Iron Crown, therefore I would never do it. Logic.

The poster below me (uses grammar, wait, wrong game.) is submerged in a tank of liquid oxygen.

The LOX boils off, and I am left feeling rather invigorated.

The next user has just been shot out an airlock on a space station, without a helmet.

Ha! Then nobody is going to post if they don't want to get sho- oh wait a minute...

I die.

I fall and a rock swings out of my hand towards the next person to post.

I am traveling near the same velocity as you, so I receive a light tap on my forehead.

The next poster is deleted from existence.
The fact that this post exists begins to dangerously overheat the next poster's brain.

I promptly install a liquid cooling system.

The next poster is stuck in an industrial refrigerator.

:|

I can breathe fire. It's all good.

Next poster is falling from a high-altitude jet with no parachute.

Thinking quickly, I use my RCS thrusters after first enabling infinite EVA fuel and slow myself for a nice touchdown.

The next poster is orbiting in a space station and a large piece of space debris is on a collision course with the station.

I use the station maneuvering thrusters to safely float away.

The next poster divides their mass times zero.

<my mass> Ãƒâ€” 0 ÃƒÂ· <something> = 0. Ergo, nothing happens.

I sprinkle some Kraken Bait onto the next poster.

The kraken is summoned. I shake hands (tentacles?) with it and tell it Danny needed it for a sacrifice. It ran off happily to oblige.

The next poster is on a command-seat lander which has already burned for deorbit.
I eject, stealing the last parachute from the lander, deflecting the attack to the next poster.

The lander is deorbiting down to Tylo. I land safely, plant a flag, and ascent back to orbit.

The next poster just had a sniper pull the trigger on them from a quarter mile away. You have 0.2 seconds to do something.

His rifle had a bogus firing pin installed.

The next poster is falling, alone without any craft, into Jool.

A single tear rolls down my cheek in my spacesuit as I realize there's no escape. I begin feeling the tug of Jool's atmosphere on my suit as I roll onto my back and cast a last look at the ship that brought me here.

I mutter into my microphone, and the automatic self-destruct on the ship engages, all overrides off.

WTG destroying a 1-man transfer vehicle.

Next poster is on a shuttle reentering down to a laythe base when the vehicle suffers a catastrophic partial disassembly (there's an entire wing missing).

As the developers have not added the actual reentry heat with the effects, i jump out in a winged flightsuit.

The next person gets attacked by eva-01 in berserker mode.

I teleport on the other side of the observable universe because that makes sense because I have no idea what EVA-01 is.

The user below me is heated to 142000000000000000000000000000000 degrees Celsius. (Note that that is the temperature physics stops working.)
A reality that kills the next poster

I switch to the next parallel universe where reality can't kill me.

I send a volley of heavy artillery at the next poster.

No problem. I'm hiding in a bunker 50 m under the surface.

I send a coke poisoned with clostridium botullinum to the next poster.

I prefer Pepsi.

I cunningly throw a kunai at the next poster.
